SENT.plain: This study shows the progression of a myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) to pre-B acute lymphoblastic leukaemia (ALL) with an unusual phenotype

On diagnosis of leukaemia bone-marrow mononuclear cells were labelled with murine monoclonal antibodies HLA-DR, VIL-A1 (CALLA), 3813, VIM-D5 and with a rabbit antiserum to TdT using a double colour indirect immunofluorescence technique
In addition simultaneous detection of cytoplasmic mu chains (Cy mu) and of TdT was carried out and a direct immunofluorescence analysis for surface membrane immunoglobulins (SmIg) was performed
Two main populations were present: the major one being HLA-DR+, Cy mu+, VIM-D5+, TdT-, CALLA-, SmIg-; the minor one HLA-DR+, Cy mu+, VIM-D5-, TdT+, CALLA-, SmIg-

The progression of our case to acute leukaemia with a population of leukaemic cells each of which demonstrated features of lymphoid and myeloid cells suggests that MDS would originate at the pluripotential stem cell level
